H0.text: The walls are the only part of the heart where cardiac muscle is found.

H1.text: The ridges are the only part of the heart where cardiac muscle is found.

H2.text: The left side is the part of the heart in which cardiac muscle is found.

H3.text: The bottom is the only part of the heart where cardiac muscle is found.

A4.text: Cardiac muscle (also called heart muscle or myocardium) is the main tissue of the wall of the heart.

A5.text: The cardiac muscle (myocardium) forms a thick middle layer between the outer layer of the heart wall (the pericardium) and the inner layer (the endocardium).
